titleproper.value:
Guide to the Guion Family Papers 
                    <lb/>
                    <date>circa 1870-1930, 1968</date>
                    <lb/>
                    <num>MS 3013</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Jennifer Gargiulo

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2017-08-09T10:32-0400</date>

extent.value: in 8 document boxes and 1 oversize folder

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: This collection contains correspondence to and from members of the Guion family between 1870 and 1930. The primary correspondent, Martha Guion, lived in New York City. Also included are legal documents, newspaper clippings, calling cards, photographs, cabinet cards, stereographs, and other materials.

p.value: Items that include presidential signatures will be presented to researchers in duplicate form.
This collection should be cited as Guion Family Papers, MS 3013, The New-York Historical Society.
Donated by the descendants of the Guion Family post-1968.

<emph render="bold">Wood Gibson Sr.</emph> and 
                <emph render="bold">Wood Gibson Jr.</emph> were the father and brother of Elizabeth Jane Gibson.

Series III. Photographs: Includes a selection of photographs, stereographs, cabinet cards, and a few negatives. The photographs are both posed and candid images of the extended Guion family, as well as a large selection of photographs of animals, which George Guion used as reference for painting. There are two photograph albums: One is of an unmarked wedding from the 1920's, and the second includes prints of animals sent to George. While most of the photographs are completely unmarked, some are labeled with the individuals who are in the image or the date, and a few have notes on the back.

                <c id="ref90" level="file">
                    <did>
                        <unittitle>Poster. Advertisement for Executor's Sale for Estate of Elizabeth J. Guion. Oversize</unittitle>
                        <container id="cid3030001" type="Box-folder" label="Mixed materials">OS-Medium</container>
                        <unitdate>1898</unitdate>
                    </did>
                    <scopecontent id="ref91">
                        <head>Scope and Contents Note</head>
                        <p>Identifies the locations of properties in New York City and elsewhere to be sold.</p>
                    </scopecontent>
                </c>
                <c id="ref92" level="file">
                    <did>
                        <unittitle>Certificate. Oversize</unittitle>
                        <container id="cid3030002" type="Box-folder" label="Mixed materials">OS-Medium</container>
                        <unitdate>1892</unitdate>
                    </did>
                    <scopecontent id="ref93">
                        <head>Scope and Contents Note</head>
                        <p>Includes a portion of the certificate from U.S. President Benjamin Harrison recognizing the appointment of Horace Dickinson Nugent as Consul from Britain for Texas and the territory of New Mexico. Much of the lower portion of the certificate is missing, including the seal and signature.</p>
                    </scopecontent>
                </c>
            </c>
